classitems.description: The Component its children
classitems.name: children

classitems.description: The classname for the container
classitems.name: className

classitems.description: Whether the focuscontainer is disabled (doesn't response to focusevents)
classitems.name: disabled

classitems.description:
Whether a click on the container (outside its elements,
should lead into focussing the container
classitems.name: focusOnContainerClick

classitems.description:
A `selector` or `index` of the focussable items that should get the initial focus.
In case of a selector, it might return multiple nodes: the one that is being used
is determined by
classitems.name: initialFocus

classitems.description:
In case `initialFocus` is a selector, it might return multiple nodes: the one that is being used.
In case of "last", it will return the last node.
classitems.name: initialFocusIndex

classitems.description:
What key/keys are responsible for re-focussing `down`. Valid values are charcodes possible prepende with
a special key: 9 or `shift+9` or `ctrl+shift+9`. Multiple key combinations can be defined bydefining an array of keyDown-values.
classitems.name: keyDown

classitems.description:
Whenever `keyEnter` is set, then the focus-container will become a `nested`- focuscontainer.
Nested focuscontainers will automaticcaly become focussable by their parent-container.

The `keyEnter` determines what key/keys are responsible for `entering` this container. Valid values are charcodes possible prepende with
a special key: 39 or `shift+39` or `ctrl+shift+39`. Multiple key combinations can be defined bydefining an array of keyUp-values.
classitems.name: keyEnter

classitems.description:
The `keyLeave` determines what key/keys are responsible for `leaving` this container and go to the parent focus-container.
Valid values are charcodes possible prepende with
a special key: 39 or `shift+39` or `ctrl+shift+39`. Multiple key combinations can be defined bydefining an array of keyUp-values.
classitems.name: keyLeave

classitems.description:
What key/keys are responsible for re-focussing `up`. Valid values are charcodes possible prepended with
a special key: 9 or `shift+9` or `ctrl+shift+9`. Multiple key combinations can be defined bydefining an array of keyUp-values.
classitems.name: keyUp

classitems.description: Whether the loop the focus when the last/first item is reached.
classitems.name: loop

classitems.description: Callback for when the component did mount.
classitems.name: onMount

classitems.description: Whether to focus on the next item whenever a `enter` is pressed on an input-element.
classitems.name: refocusOnEnterInput

classitems.description: Selector on which the focusmanager should check against when refocussing
classitems.name: selector

classitems.description: Inline styles for the focus-container
classitems.name: style

classitems.description: The tabIndex
classitems.name: tabIndex

classitems.description: The transition-time when the window needs to be scrolled in order to get the focussable node into the view.
classitems.name: transitionTime

classitems.description: componentDidMount will set an eventlistener to the `app:passwordresetrequest`-event
classitems.name: componentDidMount

classitems.description:
Extracts this.props.keyUp and this.props.keyDown into an array of `objects`
and defines them into this._keysUp and this._keysDown.
classitems.name: defineMovementKeys

classitems.description: Sets the focus on the active Element of the Container.
classitems.name: focusActiveElement

classitems.description: Sets the focus on the specified Element of the Container.
classitems.name: focusElement

params.name: index
params.description: the index of the item to be focussed

classitems.description: React render-method --> renderes the Component.
classitems.name: render
